g2601.definition: [καταβιβάζω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of the base of {{g939}}; to cause to go down, i.e. precipitate

g2602.definition: [καταβολή] from {{g2598}}; a deposition, i.e. founding; figuratively, conception

g2603.definition: [καταβραβεύω] from {{g2596}} and {{g1018}} (in its original sense); to award the price against, i.e. (figuratively) to defraud (of salvation)

g2605.definition: [καταγγέλλω] from {{g2596}} and the base of {{g32}}; to proclaim, promulgate

g2607.definition: [καταγινώσκω] from {{g2596}} and {{g1097}}; to note against, i.e. find fault with

g2608.definition: [κατάγνυμι] from {{g2596}} and the base of {{g4486}}; to rend in pieces, i.e. crack apart

g2609.definition: [κατάγω] from {{g2596}} and {{g71}}; to lead down; specially, to moor a vessel

g2610.definition: [καταγωνίζομαι] from {{g2596}} and {{g75}}; to struggle against, i.e. (by implication) to overcome

g2611.definition: [καταδέω] from {{g2596}} and {{g1210}}; to tie down, i.e. bandage (a wound)

g2613.definition: [καταδικάζω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g1349}}; to adjudge against, i.e. pronounce guilty

g2614.definition: [καταδιώκω] from {{g2596}} and {{g1377}}; to hunt down, i.e. search for

g2616.definition: [καταδυναστεύω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g1413}}; to exercise dominion against, i.e. oppress

g2617.definition: [καταισχύνω] from {{g2596}} and {{g153}}; to shame down, i.e. disgrace or (by implication) put to the blush

g2618.definition: [κατακαίω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2545}}; to burn down (to the ground), i.e. consume wholly

g2619.definition: [κατακαλύπτω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2572}}; to cover wholly, i.e. veil

g2620.definition: [κατακαυχάομαι] from {{g2596}} and {{g2744}}; to exult against (i.e. over)

g2621.definition: [κατάκειμαι] from {{g2596}} and {{g2749}}; to lie down, i.e. (by implication) be sick; specially, to recline at a meal

g2622.definition: [κατακλάω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2806}}; to break down, i.e. divide

g2623.definition: [κατακλείω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2808}}; to shut down (in a dungeon), i.e. incarcerate

g2624.definition: [κατακληροδοτέω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of a compound of {{g2819}} and {{g1325}}; to be a giver of lots to each, i.e. (by implication) to apportion an estate

g2625.definition: [κατακλίνω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2827}}; to recline down, i.e. (specially) to take a place at table

g2626.definition: [κατακλύζω] from {{g2596}} and the base of {{g2830}}; to dash (wash) down, i.e. (by implication) to deluge

g2629.definition: [κατακόπτω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2875}}; to chop down, i.e. mangle

g2630.definition: [κατακρημνίζω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g2911}}; to precipitate down

g2632.definition: [κατακρίνω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2919}}; to judge against, i.e. sentence

g2634.definition: [κατακυριεύω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2961}}; to lord against, i.e. control, subjugate

g2635.definition: [καταλαλέω] from {{g2637}}; to be a traducer, i.e. to slander

g2637.definition: [κατάλαλος] from {{g2596}} and the base of {{g2980}}; talkative against, i.e. a slanderer

g2638.definition: [καταλαμβάνω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2983}}; to take eagerly, i.e. seize, possess, etc. (literally or figuratively)

g2639.definition: [καταλέγω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3004}} (in its original meaning); to lay down, i.e. (figuratively) to enrol

g2640.definition: [κατάλειμμα] from {{g2641}}; a remainder, i.e. (by implication) a few

g2641.definition: [καταλείπω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3007}}; to leave down, i.e. behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining

g2642.definition: [καταλιθάζω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3034}}; to stone down, i.e. to death

g2643.definition: [καταλλαγή] from {{g2644}}; exchange (figuratively, adjustment), i.e. restoration to (the divine) favor

g2644.definition: [καταλλάσσω] from {{g2596}} and {{g236}}; to change mutually, i.e. (figuratively) to compound a difference

g2645.definition: [κατάλοιπος] from {{g2596}} and {{g3062}}; left down (behind), i.e remaining (plural the rest)

g2646.definition: [κατάλυμα] from {{g2647}}; properly, a dissolution (breaking up of a journey), i.e. (by implication) a lodging-place

g2647.definition: [καταλύω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3089}}; to loosen down (disintegrate), i.e. (by implication) to demolish (literally or figuratively); specially (compare {{g2646}}) to halt for the night

g2648.definition: [καταμανθάνω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3129}}; to learn thoroughly, i.e. (by implication) to note carefully

g2650.definition: [καταμένω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3306}}; to stay fully, i.e. reside

g2651.definition: [καταμόνας] from {{g2596}} and accusative case plural feminine of {{g3441}} (with {{g5561}} implied); according to sole places, i.e. (adverbially) separately

g2655.definition: [καταναρκάω] from {{g2596}} and ναρκάω (to be numb); to grow utterly torpid, i.e. (by implication) slothful (figuratively, expensive)

g2656.definition: [κατανεύω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3506}}; to nod down (towards), i.e. (by analogy) to make signs to

g2658.definition: [καταντάω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g473}}; to meet against, i.e. arrive at (literally or figuratively)

g2659.definition: [κατάνυξις] from {{g2660}}; a prickling (sensation, as of the limbs asleep), i.e. (by implication, (perhaps by some confusion with {{g3506}} or even with {{g3571}})) stupor (lethargy)

g2660.definition: [κατανύσσω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3572}}; to pierce thoroughly, i.e. (figuratively) to agitate violently ("sting to the quick")

g2661.definition: [καταξιόω] from {{g2596}} and {{g515}}; to deem entirely deserving

g2662.definition: [καταπατέω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3961}}; to trample down; figuratively, to reject with disdain

g2663.definition: [κατάπαυσις] from {{g2664}}; reposing down, i.e. (by Hebraism) abode

g2664.definition: [καταπαύω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3973}}; to settle down, i.e. (literally) to colonize, or (figuratively) to (cause to) desist

g2665.definition: [καταπέτασμα] from a compound of {{g2596}} and a congener of {{g4072}}; something spread thoroughly, i.e. (specially) the door screen (to the Most Holy Place) in the Jewish Temple

g2666.definition: [καταπίνω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4095}}; to drink down, i.e. gulp entire (literally or figuratively)

g2668.definition: [καταπλέω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4126}}; to sail down upon a place, i.e. to land at

g2669.definition: [καταπονέω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g4192}}; to labor down, i.e. wear with toil (figuratively, harass)

g2670.definition: [καταποντίζω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of the same as {{g4195}}; to plunge down, i.e. submerge

g2672.definition: [καταράομαι] middle voice from {{g2671}}; to execrate; by analogy, to doom

g2673.definition: [καταργέω] from {{g2596}} and {{g691}}; to be (render) entirely idle (useless), literally or figuratively

g2675.definition: [καταρτίζω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g739}}; to complete thoroughly, i.e. repair (literally or figuratively) or adjust

g2678.definition: [κατασείω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4579}}; to sway downward, i.e. make a signal

g2679.definition: [κατασκάπτω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4626}}; to undermine, i.e. (by implication) destroy

g2680.definition: [κατασκευάζω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g4632}}; to prepare thoroughly (properly, by external equipment; whereas {{g2090}} refers rather to internal fitness); by implication, to construct, create

g2681.definition: [κατασκηνόω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4637}}; to camp down, i.e. haunt; figuratively, to remain

g2682.definition: [κατασκήνωσις] from {{g2681}}; an encamping, i.e. (figuratively) a perch

g2683.definition: [κατασκιάζω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g4639}}; to overshade, i.e. cover

g2684.definition: [κατασκοπέω] from {{g2685}}; to be a sentinel, i.e. to inspect insidiously

g2685.definition: [κατάσκοπος] from {{g2596}} (intensive) and {{g4649}} (in the sense of a watcher); a reconnoiterer

g2686.definition: [κατασοφίζομαι] middle voice from {{g2596}} and {{g4679}}; to be crafty against, i.e. circumvent

g2687.definition: [καταστέλλω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4724}}; to put down, i.e. quell

g2688.definition: [κατάστημα] from {{g2525}}; properly, a position or condition, i.e. (subjectively) demeanor

g2690.definition: [καταστρέφω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4762}}; to turn upside down, i.e. upset

g2691.definition: [καταστρηνιάω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4763}}; to become voluptuous against

g2692.definition: [καταστροφή] from {{g2690}}; an overturn ("catastrophe"), i.e. demolition; figuratively, apostasy

g2693.definition: [καταστρώννυμι] from {{g2596}} and {{g4766}}; to strew down, i.e. (by implication) to prostrate (slay)

g2694.definition: [κατασύρω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4951}}; to drag down, i.e. arrest judicially

g2695.definition: [κατασφάττω] from {{g2596}} and {{g4969}}; to kill down, i.e. slaughter

g2697.definition: [κατάσχεσις] from {{g2722}}; a holding down, i.e. occupancy

g2698.definition: [κατατίθημι] from {{g2596}} and {{g5087}}; to place down, i.e. deposit (literally or figuratively)

g2699.definition: [κατατομή] from a compound of {{g2596}} and τέμνω (to cut); a cutting down (off), i.e. mutilation (ironically) Compare {{g609}}.

g2700.definition: [κατατοξεύω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g5115}}; to shoot down with an arrow or other missile
